description: This course provides a critical analysis of the development of Christian thought in the
Middle Ages and Reformation, 11th through 16th centuries. Particular attention is paid to the
great theological systems of the Middle Ages and to the theological aims of the 16th-century
reforming movements, drawing upon readings from Anselm, Aquinas, Bonaventure, Luther, Calvin,
and others.  Prerequisite: BTS-B. Counts toward medieval studies major.
